data.title: Replaces glitchy blue tiberium art with TS-style remapable tiberium art
data.body:
Fixes visual glitches with old blue tiberium art, makes tiberium remapable for potential addition of other color variations.

![blue-temp1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/3475534/deccc528-02f1-11e4-8343-59be702dbeea.png)
![blue-des1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/3475536/e1c6cd8c-02f1-11e4-9ed6-70aab0c4f9cb.png)

data.title: Fixed resources growing on building bibs and behind trees
data.body: as described in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5556.

data.title: Fixed SeedsResources messing with make animation
data.body:
This fixes #5300, but actually it does a lot more than that. 
- The split of WithActiveAnimation from SeedsResource removes the rendering related stuff from logic Tick to TickRender like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5640 does for all other traits that did not hide their rendering abilities from me. It also removes the need to define fake active animations that are identical to idle (RA mines). It also gets feature parity with our recent building render traits such as allowing to disable it when it is on low power.
- I also found SeedsResources doing multiple expensive trait lookups every few ticks. This caches everything in the constructor to further improve performance.

data.title: Player name resets with every change in lobby
data.body:
Player names can now be changed freely but it still resets every time there is an action in the lobby, when someone clicks ready for example.

data.title: Fixed a crash when trying to capture husks that have been destroyed.
data.body: as desribed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5793 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5638.

data.title: screen cracks
data.body:
release-20140608

Since the mod-choosing screen, there is an erratic cracking of the graphics (see picture for static snapshot) that remains in every in-game screen. Playable but very distracting.

Fresh install of Ubuntu 14.04LTS, renderer Gallium 0.4 on AMD RS880, OpenGL/ES version 3.0 Mesa 10.1.0

On Ubuntu 12.04LTS it works just fine.

![openra-corruptedscr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3928453/3456381/13575db2-01ee-11e4-9e6c-2d03f93577fc.png)

data.title: Made GetSpawnOccupants more robust against invalid list queries
data.body:
I hope this fixes #5588.

> Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.

data.title: Fixed a crash in Tiberian Dawn when a production tooltip is being rendered while the last accompanying production queue is destroyed.
data.body: Fixes #5624.

data.title: Fixed the Tiberian Sun harvester
data.body: Got it to a state where it does not crash. Replacing voxel animations does not work as I hoped though.

data.title: APC for D2k
data.body: Gruntlord6, FedaYkin and athanasios was talking about an APC for D2K in FED2K. http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/page-18 I think it is a good idea. Dune 2000 does't have any APC unlike others. --- Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2923605-apc-for-d2k?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Added Tiberium explosions to destroyed harvesters in Tiberian Sun
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5305 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5749.

data.title: Added a new Lint check for invalid map cordons
data.body: This will protect both this repository and http://resource.openra.net from invalid submissions that crash the game. It is also documented at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Mapping#file-format but no one reads manuals.

data.title: Mammoth Crash
data.body:
now ... im not 100% sure , but i think this happend when when someone of my team tryed to "steal" with a hijacker a enemy mammoth that has been cronoed from my hand , which failed , and i tryed to "capture" with a mechanic the dead husk ..     somewhere at this point the game crashed 

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20140608
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18408
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (4tnk 1411 (not in world))
   bei OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
   bei OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[T](Actor actor)
   bei OpenRA.Mods.RA.Buildings.BuildingInfluence.<BuildingInfluence>m__59D(Actor a)
   bei System.Action`1.Invoke(T obj)
   bei OpenRA.World.Remove(Actor a)
   bei OpenRA.Actor.<ChangeOwner>c__AnonStoreyC2.<>m__256(World w)
   bei OpenRA.World.Tick()
   bei OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   bei OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   bei OpenRA.Game.Run()
   bei OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   bei OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: TD Tiberium tree fixes
data.body:
Tweaks blue tiberium tree offsets (closes #5744).
Fixes position in editor.
Gets rid of duplicate sequences and uses 'Image:' instead.

data.title: Use YouTube for cenematics?
data.body:
I'm not sure how cinematic are handled currently, but what if the game just streamed them from YouTube, that way we save on install space? 

A option for download them would be good too, I guess someone might want to play without a internet connection.

data.title: Iron curtian unit pre-selection.
data.body:
Its difficult to use the iron curtain on moving units, even if they somehow manage to stay grouped correctly.

What if you select your units, a symbol is placed above their health bar, and then you hit the iron curtain button a second time to actually activate it on those selected units. 
Maybe a range limit on how far apart they can be from the first unit you selected?

Could also be useful for using it on important buildings like a missile silo to keep it ready to be protected.

Does iron curtain have a hotkey?

PS: What if iron curtain healed the units it was used on?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2913907-iron-curtian-unit-pre-selection?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Documented the various overlay and animation change traits
data.body: They all kinda sound the same, are often named very generic and used hard-coded sequence names that forced people to read the source code or wait for the game to crash to find out. This should improve https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits a lot in that regard. Includes some minor cleanup as well.

data.title: Some spawns on map Brimstone spawns are not centered
data.body:
Separated from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5778#issuecomment-47648652

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3442763/7118685e-0119-11e4-81f2-bdf9bdee78f7.png)

data.title: Sound and Input cleanup
data.body: This is just some house-keeping. Essentially a followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5235 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5248. The organisation in this regard has been historically weird. I believe this arranges it better without making too many changes to the overall structure. Creating a new OpenRA.Platform.dll as proposed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5274 is a lot more trouble than it is worth. I tried it at first, but there are still a lot of ties back and forth. We also don't support an SDL2/OpenTK alternative.

data.title: Ported GDI01 to the new Lua API
data.body:
There are still some things to do where I need help:
- [ ] `Fatal Lua Error: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Unable to convert parameter 0 to Player`
- [x] The second parameter in PlayMovieFullscreen should be optional.

data.title: Implement Format80 RLE compression
data.body:
Makes the SHP writer a little smarter and the files produced a lot smaller.

This doesn't use all the encodings available but it's probably enough to close #5295.

data.body: Now that the pre-requisites are in place: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAMasterServer/issues/19 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5748.
